title: Transportation Essentials
context: Public transit in Korea is extensive—knowing the key words keeps you moving.
타다 (to ride) and 내리다 (to get off) pair with any vehicle.
Cards are king: a 교통카드 works on buses, subways, and some taxis.

sentences.english: I take the bus to the office.
I got off two stops earlier.
At Gangnam Station I transfer to Line 2.
Do you have a transit card? Did you top it up?

explanation: Vehicles take object particle sometimes but often omitted: 버스(를) 타요. Use 에서 with stations for actions: 역에서 갈아타요.
호선 is subway line: 2호선 (line 2), 9호선 (line 9). Attach 으로/로 after the line number.
충전하다 = to recharge/top up (a card). 잔액 means remaining balance: 잔액이 없어요 (no balance).
Taxis often ask '카드요? 현금요?' Answer with the method. Some taxis accept 교통카드 taps too.
For buses, press the stop button before your stop: 다음 정류장에서 내릴게요 (I'll get off at the next stop).
